Description: Shallow asymmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: with a convex cutting edge and a concave butt with three drilled binding-holes. The cutting edge is quite sharp and is indented in parts. Before cleaning, the blade was thickly corroded. There is considerable pitting on both faces.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has shown that after casting the blade was worked and annealed but that it was not used.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (70)
